meanings.definition: The quality or state of being reluctant or unwilling.
meanings.sent1: Her loathness to try new foods made dinner time a challenge.
meanings.sent2: His loathness towards public speaking was evident in his nervous demeanor.
meanings.sent3: Despite his loathness for exercise, he decided to join a gym for health reasons.
meanings.sent4: The loathness in her voice was palpable as she declined the invitation.
meanings.sent5: The loathness in his eyes betrayed his true feelings about the situation.

meanings.definition: A feeling of strong dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The movie's loathness for violence made it suitable for all audiences.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her loathness for the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent3: His loathness for horror movies led him to always choose comedies instead.
meanings.sent4: The loathness she felt towards the bully was evident in her body language.
meanings.sent5: The loathness in his tone made it clear he would not compromise on the matter.

meanings.definition: Reluctance or unwillingness to do something.
meanings.sent1: His loathness to wake up early often made him late for work.
meanings.sent2: The student's loathness to participate in class discussions was concerning.
meanings.sent3: Despite her loathness to dance, she agreed to join her friends on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The loathness in his actions showed he was not fully committed to the project.
meanings.sent5: Her loathness to ask for help hindered her progress in the assignment.
